Euless City Council
===================





![City Council](https://www.eulesstx.gov/home/showpublishedimage/6958/638427379818900000)
The Euless City Council serves as the governing and law making body of the City of Euless. There are seven members: a Mayor and six Council Members. They are elected for three-year terms and serve without compensation.  Five members of the City Council shall constitute a quorum.

The Mayor Pro Tem is selected by the Council Members each year at the first regular meeting following the general City election. In the absence or disability of the Mayor, the Mayor Pro Tem performs all the Mayor's duties.

Regular City Council meetings take place at City Hall at 7 p.m. on the second and fourth Tuesdays of the month. The public is welcome to attend or
view the meeting live
online.

* **Mayor:**
  [Linda Martin](https://www.eulesstx.gov/city-hall/euless-city-council/mayor)
* [Tim Stinneford](https://www.eulesstx.gov/city-hall/euless-city-council/place-1)
  , Mayor Pro Tem
* [Jeremy Tompkins](https://www.eulesstx.gov/city-hall/euless-city-council/place-2)
* [Eddie Price](https://www.eulesstx.gov/city-hall/euless-city-council/place-3)
* [Perry Bynum](https://www.eulesstx.gov/city-hall/euless-city-council/place-4)
* [Annabel Eads](https://www.eulesstx.gov/city-hall/euless-city-council/place-5)
* [Tika Paudel](https://www.eulesstx.gov/city-hall/euless-city-council/place-6)

*"All powers and authority which are expressly or explicitly conferred on or possessed by the City shall be vested in and exercised by the City Council, provided, however, that the Council shall have no power to exercise those powers which are expressly conferred upon other City officers by this Charter."*

The Texas Ethics Commission requires the filing of Candidate /Officeholder Campaign Finance Reports for candidates and officeholders with an active Campaign Treasurer Appointment (CTA) on file with the City Secretary’s Office.
